Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I would love to get rid of "accounts", but i guess it potentially not make some wallets work?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I think "accounts" should be removed from RPC interface, just leave the internals, like a dingleberry

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there are a lot of RPCs dealing with accounts that, in theory, need to learn about dpowconfs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i would rather delete the RPCs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but also, don't want to be like Bitcoin Core deleting `getinfo` like a madman

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the accounts feature was written for a very early BTC exchange, the story goes. They wanted to manage all user funds directly in their wallet. It never worked out for them, they ended up not using it, and it's been in BTC core ever since, rotting

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: thanks for background apparent story.  tales from the crypt üòÉ

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: accounts are deprecated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: dont use them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all places that have account just use ""

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: BTC partially deprecated it, zcash deprecated more. I never use them. assume they dont work at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @grewalsatinder getbalance doesnt need a privkey to calculate it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is interesting getnewaddress doesnt, but that is because it doesnt have to decrypt anything. it makes a new privkey and then adds it to the wallet is my guess

Author: jorian#4555
Content: @grewalsatinder i see that the code doesn't do any validation of RPC arguments a user enters. for example, i need to use privkeys when signing a multisig transaction, and before my rust code does the actual request, it would first check if the data is actually a privkey. are you planning on doing that too?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: or do you want to keep the layer as thin as possible

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: yes, I plan to add extra custom features of making creating address wif and all such conversions later to this lib

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: then I'll add all those validation checks for the address pubkeys and whatever is required

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: for now I'm only adding the CURL API work to it.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: the validation and error etc are all reflected from the API itself, so just giving back those same errors in return to API
